alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 3:32PM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, precipitation has tapered to scattered lingering snow showers but the main concern is icy conditions due to the re-freezing of wet surfaces as temperatures continue to plummet. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Carbon and Monroe. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
